name: Dustin Krause
title: Senior Data Engineer — Capital One (12+ years)
summary: I architect and optimize data pipelines and platforms to turn raw signals into trusted analytics and ML features. I focus on cloud-native streaming and batch architectures, observability, and production-grade MLOps.

projects.name: Streaming Fraud Detection Pipeline
projects.description: Low-latency pipeline using Kafka + Flink/Kinesis for near real-time fraud scoring and alerting.

projects.name: Unified Data Platform Migration
projects.description: Led migration from legacy ETL to cloud-native pipelines (GCP DataFlow/Apache Beam, BigQuery, Terraform).

bullets: Senior-level data engineering leadership and platform improvements (role summary placeholder — update with specific accomplishments).
Engineered robust ETL/ELT pipelines using Apache Spark, Airflow and Python to process structured and semi-structured data from operational and third-party sources.
Built real-time ingestion pipelines with Apache Kafka, Kafka Connect and Flink to support low-latency analytics.
Implemented Airflow DAGs with Great Expectations for automated data quality validations.
Designed Terraform IaC to provision Kubernetes clusters and data services; improved deployment repeatability.
Built high-throughput real-time data pipelines using Kafka, Kinesis and Spark Streaming handling millions of events per second.
Designed a data lake on AWS (S3, Glue, Athena) and optimized Snowflake warehouses; improved query efficiency by ~40%.
Constructed distributed ETL framework with Spark and Airflow processing 320 GB/day and improving job speed by 28%.
Automated CI/CD with GitHub Actions and integrated cloud deployment pipelines to Kubernetes.
Collected, cleaned, and validated datasets to support weekly business reporting and analyses.
Built interactive reports with Power BI and Excel dashboards and automated reports using macros (VBA).
Designed A/B testing frameworks that contributed to measurable business improvements.
